snippet: Data isn’t enough. We must listen to voters, not just measure them.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Republican pollster Frank Lutz weighs shortcomings of polls in aftermath of House Majority Leader Eric Cantor's Virginia Republican primary loss to David Brat; points out polls had shown him with 34 percent lead; holds polls are tools but cannot predict the future, despite increasing media demands for certainty; asserts more qualitative insight, gained from face to face talks with voters, is needed in order to paint more accurate political picture.
lead_paragraph: Data isn’t enough. We must listen to voters, not just measure them.

headline.seo: Republicans Couldn’t Predict Eric Cantor’s Loss
